author: cbc
title: OPP investigating after threat received at Elliot Lake Secondary School
text:
Students are still waiting to hear if classes will resume Tuesday after East Algoma Ontario Provincial Police responded to a threatening phone call Monday morning at Elliot Lake Secondary School.
According to a written release issued Monday morning, police said the caller indicated that there was an explosive device in the school. The call was made around 7:45 a.m.
The OPP Explosives Disposal Unit and the OPP Emergency Response Team were called to the school.
The Algoma District School Board said in a release issued Monday afternoon that the police investigation was delayed due to getting resources to the scene.
The board said it's unclear if classes will resume on Tuesday â€” information is likely to be released later Monday evening.
The threat caused the school to close and buses to be cancelled on Monday. Police also reported the school was evacuated. The school board said students had not yet arrived when staff members were told to leave.
The OPP has also closed the intersections at Hillside Drive South and Mississauga Avenue and Mississauga Avenue at Dieppe Avenue.
Police are asking residents to avoid the area.
